citation.article-title: Muricauda ruestringensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a facultatively anaerobic, appendaged bacterium from German North Sea intertidal sediment.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Muricauda (Mu'ri.cau.da. L. masc. gen. n. muris of the mouse; L. fem. n. cauda the tail; N.L. fem. n. Muricauda tail of the mouse, referring to the cellular appendages observed on some cells)
Cells can grow optimally over a mesophilic temperature range between 20 and 30 Â°C.
The fatty acid profile is characterized by large amounts of branched fatty acids.
According to 16S rDNA analysis and binding of the rRNA to the oligonucleotide CF319a, Muricauda is a member of the family Flavobacteriaceae within the phylum `Cytophaga-Flavobacterium-Bacteroides'.
